name: Enhanced Database Comparison and Data Validation
description: I want to compare data between different databases with advanced features
So that I can validate data migration and synchronization with comprehensive analysis

steps.name: I load configuration from "config.ini"

elements.name: Enhanced Oracle to PostgreSQL comparison with performance monitoring

steps.name: I load configuration from "config.ini"
I connect to Oracle database using "SAT_ORACLE" configuration
I connect to PostgreSQL database using "SAT_POSTGRES" configuration
I enable progress monitoring
I load source data using table from config section "comparison_settings" key "SRCE_TABLE" on Oracle
I load target data using table from config section "comparison_settings" key "TRGT_TABLE" on PostgreSQL
I validate data quality for source DataFrame
I validate data quality for target DataFrame
I compare DataFrames using primary key from config section "comparison_settings"
I generate data quality report
data quality score should be above "90.0"
I print performance metrics
I export all results to Excel file "enhanced_oracle_to_postgres_comparison.xlsx"
I export all comparison results with timestamp
I save comparison results as JSON file "enhanced_comparison_results.json"

elements.name: Enhanced comparison with omit columns, values, and quality reporting

steps.name: I load configuration from "config.ini"
I connect to Oracle database using "SAT_ORACLE" configuration
I connect to PostgreSQL database using "SAT_POSTGRES" configuration
I enable progress monitoring
I execute direct query "SELECT emp_id, name, salary, last_updated, status, created_date FROM employees" on Oracle as source

arguments.value: SELECT emp_id, name, salary, last_updated, status, created_date FROM employees
arguments.name: query

steps.name: I execute direct query "SELECT emp_id, name, salary, last_updated, status, created_date FROM employees" on PostgreSQL as target

arguments.value: SELECT emp_id, name, salary, last_updated, status, created_date FROM employees
arguments.name: query

steps.name: I validate data quality for source DataFrame
I validate data quality for target DataFrame
I compare DataFrames using primary key "emp_id" omitting columns "last_updated,created_date" and values "N,None,NULL,---,INACTIVE,inactive"
I generate data quality report
data quality score should be above "95.0"
I print the comparison summary
I print performance metrics
I export all comparison results with timestamp

elements.name: Enhanced full audit comparison with all advanced features

steps.name: I load configuration from "config.ini"
I connect to Oracle database using "SAT_ORACLE" configuration
I connect to PostgreSQL database using "SAT_POSTGRES" configuration
I enable progress monitoring
I load source data using table from config section "comparison_settings" key "SRCE_TABLE" on Oracle
I load target data using table from config section "comparison_settings" key "TRGT_TABLE" on PostgreSQL

I validate data quality for target DataFrame
source DataFrame should have no duplicate records
target DataFrame should have no duplicate records

elements.name: Enhanced Oracle to Oracle comparison with advanced validation

steps.name: I load configuration from "config.ini"
I connect to Oracle database using "SAT_ORACLE" configuration
I enable progress monitoring
I execute direct query "SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name, salary, department FROM employees WHERE dept_id = 10" on Oracle as source

arguments.value: SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name, salary, department FROM employees WHERE dept_id = 10
arguments.name: query

steps.name: I execute direct query "SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name, salary, department FROM employees_backup WHERE dept_id = 10" on Oracle as target

arguments.value: SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name, salary, department FROM employees_backup WHERE dept_id = 10
arguments.name: query

steps.name: I validate data quality for source DataFrame
I validate data quality for target DataFrame
I compare DataFrames using primary key "emp_id"
I generate data quality report
data quality score should be above "98.0"
there should be no missing records in either DataFrame
all fields should match between source and target DataFrames
I print performance metrics
I export all comparison results with timestamp

elements.name: Enhanced complete data migration validation with all export formats and quality reporting

steps.name: I load configuration from "config.ini"
I connect to Oracle database using "SAT_ORACLE" configuration
I connect to PostgreSQL database using "SAT_POSTGRES" configuration
I enable progress monitoring
I read query from config section "queries" key "migration_source_query"
I execute query on Oracle and store as source DataFrame
I read query from config section "queries" key "migration_target_query"
I execute query on PostgreSQL and store as target DataFrame
I validate data quality for source DataFrame
I validate data quality for target DataFrame
source DataFrame should have no duplicate records
target DataFrame should have no duplicate records
I compare DataFrames using primary key from config section "comparison_settings"
I generate data quality report
data quality score should be above "90.0"
I print the comparison summary
I print DataFrame info for source
I print DataFrame info for target
I print performance metrics
I export all comparison results with timestamp
I save comparison results as JSON file "enhanced_migration_results.json"
